acm.graphics

Class GLineGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • acm.graphics.GObject
      • acm.graphics.GLineGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GScalable, Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<GPoint>

    public class GLineGroup
extends GObject
implements Iterable<GPoint>
    A line group represents a collection of points that form line segments. A line group can be drawn on the screen and looks similar to a collection of GLine objects positioned one after another.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GLineGroup()
      Creates a new line group that does not contain any points.

      Returns the number of points that have been added to the line group.

      Shifts every point in this line group by the given amounts.

        public boolean contains(double x,
                        double y)
        Returns true if any of the line segments in this line group touch the given point.
        Overrides:
        contains in class GObject
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the point being tested
        y - The y-coordinate of the point being tested
        Returns:
        true if the point (x, y) is inside the object, and false otherwise

      • getBounds

        public GRectangle getBounds()
        Returns a bounding rectangle that tightly contains this line group. The rectangle's min x/y are the minimum x/y values of any point in the line group, and the rectangle's max x/y are the maximum x/y values of any point in the line group.
        Specified by:
        getBounds in class GObject
        Returns:
        The bounding box for this object

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(double x,
                        double y)
        Sets the line group's top/left corner to the given x/y pair. Initially every line group has a top/left corner at (0, 0), regardless of any points that may have been added to it.
        Overrides:
        setLocation in class GObject
        Parameters:
        x - The new x-coordinate for the object
        y - The new y-coordinate for the object
